page.title: 03INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT
page.content: {Derwent Howe}is an industrial project geared to{private sector {development.}This is where local firms will be invited to start a business in one of the workshops provided on the site. The large industries that are to be set up there are still unknown but it is hoped to attract some{high {technology industries. There is a{rail making plant}owned by British Steel on part of the site,and is the only one if it's kind outside Japan. The{MOBET}group who run the scheme decided that the main part of the scheme should be industrial because it is hoped to create about{1000 more {jobs.}The scheme will have cost Â£10 million by mid 1985 and when{completed {in 1988}the{total cost}will be about {Â£14-Â£15 million.
